Cultural differences can cause tension and conflict in the workplace, leading to a hostile work environment.
Limited English proficiency can make it difficult for employees to understand important company policies and procedures, leading to confusion and potential legal issues.
Language barriers can make it challenging for employees to collaborate effectively, leading to missed opportunities for innovation and creativity.
Inadequate language support can lead to feelings of isolation and disengagement among multilingual employees, potentially leading to high turnover rates.
Language barriers can make it difficult for employees to provide customer service in a timely and effective manner, leading to negative customer experiences and potential loss of business.
